question: 地震
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>earth</kanji> <kanji>earthquake</kanji> is just another way to say <vocabulary>earthquake</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. Notice that <ja>地</ja> is read as <ja>じ</ja> instead of <ja>ち</ja>. You've seen this happen a few times before, so just try to remember that this is the case here.
